skill.name: Acrobatics
entries: Your Dexterity (Acrobatics) check covers your attempt to stay on your feet in a tricky situation, such as when you're trying to run across a sheet of ice, balance on a tightrope, or stay upright on a rocking ship's deck. The DM might also call for a Dexterity (Acrobatics) check to see if you can perform acrobatic stunts, including dives, rolls, somersaults, and flips.

skill.name: Athletics
entries: Your Strength (Athletics) check covers difficult situations you encounter while climbing, jumping, or swimming. Examples include the following activities:

items: You attempt to climb a sheer or slippery cliff, avoid hazards while scaling a wall, or cling to a surface while something is trying to knock you off.
You try to jump an unusually long distance or pull off a stunt mid jump.

You struggle to swim or stay afloat in treacherous currents, storm-tossed waves, or areas of thick seaweed. Or another creature tries to push or pull you underwater or otherwise interfere with your swimming.

skill.name: Computers
entries: Your Intelligence (Computers) check covers attempts to hack computer systems, navigate unfamiliar programs or operating systems, reprogram a computer-operated panel or device, or extract data from a secure server.

skill.name: Deception
entries: Your Charisma (Deception) check determines whether you can convincingly hide the truth, either verbally or through your actions. This deception can encompass everything from misleading others through ambiguity to telling outright lies. Typical situations include trying to fast-talk a guard, con a merchant, earn money through gambling, pass yourself off in a disguise, dull someone's suspicions with false assurances, or maintain a straight face while telling a blatant lie.

skill.name: Engineering
entries: Your Intelligence (Engineering) check covers your knowledge of electronic and mechanical devices and machines. It may determine your ability to repair devices, spot weaknesses in mechanical defense systems, diagnose potential vehicle failures before they happen, or find expensive parts to salvage.

skill.name: Insight
entries: Your Wisdom (Insight) check decides whether you can determine the true intentions of a creature, such as when searching out a lie or predicting someone's next move. Doing so involves gleaning clues from body language, speech habits, and changes in mannerisms.

skill.name: Intimidation
entries: When you attempt to influence someone through overt threats, hostile actions, and physical violence, the DM might ask you to make a Charisma (Intimidation) check. Examples include trying to pry information out of a prisoner, convincing street thugs to back down from a confrontation, or using the edge of a broken bottle to convince a sneering vizier to reconsider a decision.

skill.name: Investigation
entries: When you look around for clues and make deductions based on those clues, you make an Intelligence (Investigation) check. You might deduce the location of a hidden object, discern from the appearance of a wound what kind of weapon dealt it, or determine the weakest point in a tunnel that could cause it to collapse. Poring through ancient scrolls in search of a hidden fragment of knowledge might also call for an Intelligence (Investigation) check.

skill.name: Medicine
entries: A Wisdom (Medicine) check lets you try to treat a wound, stabilize a dying companion, or diagnose an illness.

skill.name: Perception
entries: Your Wisdom (Perception) check lets you spot, hear, or otherwise detect the presence of something. It measures your general awareness of your surroundings and the keenness of your senses.

For example, you might try to hear a conversation through a closed door, eavesdrop under an open window, or hear monsters moving stealthily in the forest. Or you might try to spot things that are obscured or easy to miss, whether they are orcs lying in ambush on a road, thugs hiding in the shadows of an alley, or candlelight under a closed secret door.

skill.name: Performance
entries: Your Charisma (Performance) check determines how well you can delight an audience with music, dance, acting, storytelling, or some other form of entertainment.

skill.name: Persuasion
entries: When you attempt to influence someone or a group of people with tact, social graces, or good nature, the DM might ask you to make a Charisma (Persuasion) check. Typically, you use persuasion when acting in good faith, to foster friendships, make cordial requests, or exhibit proper etiquette. Examples of persuading others include convincing a chamberlain to let your party see the king, negotiating peace between warring tribes, or inspiring a crowd of townsfolk.

skill.name: Science (Life)
entries: This skill reflects your knowledge of biology, anatomy, pathology, genetics, or other scientific endeavor concerning life. An Intelligence (Life Science) check may allow the character to identify animals, plants, and microorganisms and recall information about their anatomy or other properties.

skill.name: Science (Physical)
entries: This skill reflects your knowledge of chemistry, physics, mathematics, geology, or other scientific endeavor concerning non-living systems. An Intelligence (Physical Science) check may allow the character to identify chemical compounds and elements, create toxins, explosives, or powerful solvents, solve complex mathematical puzzles, and explain anomalous natural events.

skill.name: Science (Social)
entries: This skill reflects your knowledge of history, psychology, philosophy, anthropology, religion, or other academic field concerning the humanoid condition. An Intelligence (Social Science) check may allow your character to explain cultural traditions, recall relevant laws and regulations, discern mental conditions, and recite lore about historical events or people.

skill.name: Sleight of Hand
entries: Whenever you attempt an act of legerdemain or manual trickery, such as planting something on someone else or concealing an object on your person, make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check. The DM might also call for a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check to determine whether you can lift a coin purse off another person or slip something out of another person's pocket.

skill.name: Stealth
entries: Make a Dexterity (Stealth) check when you attempt to conceal yourself from enemies, slink past guards, slip away without being noticed, or sneak up on someone without being seen or heard.

skill.name: Survival
entries: The DM might ask you to make a Wisdom (Survival) check to follow tracks, hunt wild game, guide your group through frozen wastelands, identify signs that owlbears live nearby, predict the weather, or avoid quicksand and other natural hazards.

entries.name: Ammunition
entries: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. The type of ammunition is listed with this property. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition or 'shot'. For bows, drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended arrows or crossbow bolts by taking a minute to search the battlefield. The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use and cannot be recovered.
If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon.

entries.name: Auto
entries: Automatic weapons have the capability of firing several shots with each attack. Before making an attack with a firearm with this property, you can choose to set the weapon to single-fire or auto-fire mode. When in auto-fire mode, you have a -2 penalty to your attack rolls due to weapon recoil and each attack consumes five shots. A damage value in parentheses appears with the propertyâthe damage when the weapon is set to auto-fire.

entries.name: Chain
entries: You have access to a special attack option. Immediately after hitting a creature with this weapon as part of the Attack action, you can choose to sustain the initial hit and "chain" any remaining attacks that you would normally have access to through the Extra Attack feature. When you do so, you forfeit all remaining attacks and deal additional damage of the weapon's primary damage type equal to the number listed in parentheses for each forfeited attack.

entries.name: Feed
entries: A firearm with the feed property can only hold a limited number of ammunition rounds at a time, and it can only be loaded one round at a time. You can use a bonus action or substitute one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to load one round into the weapon. Alternatively, you can use an action to fully reload the weapon to its capacity, which is listed with this property in parentheses.

entries.name: Light
entries: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons. Additionally, when making a ranged attack with a weapon that has both the light and thrown properties, you can draw the weapon as part of the attack as long as you have a free hand and the weapon is kept in an accessible location, such as a bandolier or belt.

entries.name: Loading
entries: Because of the time required to load this weapon, you can fire only one piece of ammunition from it when you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

entries.name: Reload
entries: Weapons with the reload property can connect to a container of ammunition, such as a magazine, energy cell, or fuel tank. A limited number of shots can be consumedâindicated by the number in parenthesesâbefore the container must be replaced using your choice of an action or a bonus action. You must have a replacement container of the appropriate size and type to reload the weapon.

entries.name: Spread
entries: Some weapons, like shotguns, fire a number of small projectiles in a random âspreadâ pattern. These weapons are very powerful in close quarters, but their effectiveness decreases with distance from the target. There are two values included with this property in parentheses. The first value is the weaponâs âclose rangeâ in feet, and the second is the weapon's damage die when attacking a target in close range.

Additionally, when attacking a target beyond normal range, you do not have disadvantage on the attack roll, but the damage dealt on a hit is halved. If an attack beyond normal range is a hit, you can apply the attackâs damage to one additional creature that you can see within 5 feet of the target. You canât attack a target beyond the weaponâs long range as normal.

entries.name: Strength
entries: This property is accompanied by a number, which is the minimum Strength score required to wield the weapon effectively. If you do not meet this requirement, you have disadvantage on all attack rolls made with the weapon.

itemType.name: Sidearm
entries: These are one-handed firearms that require little training to use effectively.

itemType.name: Longarm
entries: These are two-handed firearms that require more specialized training to use effectively.

entries.name: Special
entries: Due to the weight of its fuel canisters, this weapon requires an action to reload. Additionally, you have access to a special attack option. As an action, you can spray fire in a 15-foot cone or a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 fire damage. This action consumes 5 shots.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon is used to fire grenade items. The type of grenade determines the damage or effect. When a grenade launched from this weapon forces a creature to make a saving throw, the DC is equal to 8 + your Dexterity modifier. You add your proficiency bonus to the DC if you are proficient with this weapon.

You can target a creature or an area when launching a grenade. When targeting a creature, make an attack roll against the creature. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 1d8 plus your Dexterity modifier. Regardless of a hit, the creature's space becomes the origin of the effect.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon is used to fire rocket items. The type of rocket determines the damage or effect. When a rocket launched from this weapon forces a creature to make a saving throw, the DC is equal to 8 + your Dexterity modifier. You add your proficiency bonus to the DC if you are proficient with this weapon.

You can target a creature or an area when launching a rocket. When targeting a creature, make an attack roll against the creature. On a hit, the target automatically fails its saving throw against the rocket's effect. Regardless of a hit, the creature's space becomes the origin of the effect.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon features a hydraulic piston that can be used to add force to your punches. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can activate the piston. When you do so, the weapon's damage dice becomes 1d10, and you add your proficiency bonus instead of your Strength modifier to the attack's damage. Once the piston has been activated, the system must recharge and it cannot be used again until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon is cumbersome to wield and is designed for accuracy at long ranges. When attacking with this weapon, you have disadvantage on attack rolls against targets within 30 feet of you. Additionally, because of the time required to line up an accurate shot, you can fire only one piece of ammunition from it when you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make, unless you move 0 feet on your turn.

spell.name: Advanced Treatment
entries: Up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range each regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d8} + your powercasting ability modifier. This power has no effect on undead or constructs.
Hyperlanes (p. 110)
PHB (Prayer of Healing, p. 267)

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this power using a power slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Alert
entries: You create a program to alert you when certain conditions arise. This alarm must be used on a video camera network or some other type of sensor that can detect the trigger you set. Until the hack ends, you are alerted whenever your triggering condition is detected.

The alarm itself is only audible to you and people you invite to this hack trigger. The hack alerts you with a ping on your device when the triggering condition is sensed. This ping awakens you if you are sleeping.

Triggers are typically linked to video feeds, often using facial recognition, or a general âno one is allowed inside Xâ type command. This hack only affects one sensor (such as a camera or door). Attempts to evade trigger recognition require a Charisma (Deception) or Dexterity (Stealth) ability check against your hack DC.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this power using a 2nd level spell slot, the duration increases to 8 hours. Using a 3rd level spell slot, the duration is 24 hours.
GeneFunk 2090

spell.name: Counterattack
entries: You direct your allies to openings in enemy defenses and bolster their confidence. When you cast this power, choose a number of creatures you can see within range equal to your proficiency bonus. For the duration, each of these creatures may use its reaction to make one weapon attack when it is hit by an attack.
Hyperlanes (p. 119)

spell.name: Intercept Communications
entries: You monitor all communications transmitted or received within range for the duration.
Hyperlanes (p. 110)

spell.name: Gravity Field
entries: You deploy a device at a point you can see within range that creates a 30-foot-radius sphere of altered gravity centered on that point. When you cast this power, you choose the effect: high gravity, low gravity, or zero gravity.
Based on: Alter Gravity from Hyperlanes (p.110)

spell.name: Analysis
entries: Choose one creature, object, or vehicle you can see within range. If the target is an object or vehicle, you learn all of its major functions and its current and maximum hit points. If the target is a creature, you learn its current and maximum hit points along with any damage immunities, resistances, or vulnerabilities it possesses.
Hyperlanes (p.110)

spell.name: Electromagnetic Field
entries: You deploy a device at a point that you can see within range that creates an electromagnetic field in a 15-foot-radius sphere around it. Within this sphere, creatures must roll a {@dice d10} each time they attempt to use a different device that relies on electronics to function. The roll is made before the device is used or attack is made. On a roll of 6 or higher, the device functions normally; otherwise, it ceases to function until the start of their next turn or until they leave the field.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this power using a power slot of 4th level or higher, all electronic devices cease to function while within the field.
Based on Hyperlanes Antiscience Field (p. 110)

spell.name: Precision Fire
entries: For the duration, your ranged weapon attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this power using a power slot of 4th level, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the power for up to 1 hour. When you use a power slot of 5th level, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 8 hours.
Based on Arcing Fire from Hyperlanes (p. 111)

spell.name: Elemental Ammo
entries: You reload your weapon with a canister containing special ammunition. Choose a damage type: cold, fire, or lightning. Your attacks with the weapon deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of the selected type. This effect lasts until six pieces of ammunition have been expended.

components.m: Ranged weapon with the reload property

spell.name: Dead Aim
entries: You have advantage on ranged attacks while you maintain {@status concentration} on this power.
Hyperlanes (p. 121)

spell.name: Bash
entries: Make a melee power attack against a creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage. If the target is a construct, the damage is instead {@damage 1d12} bludgeoning damage.
The power's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8} or {@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8} or {@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8} or {@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Maneuver
entries: One creature you choose within range can immediately move up to its speed.

spell.name: Taunt
entries: You attempt to goad a target into attacking you. Choose one creature you can see within range. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or suffer disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn.
Hyperlanes (Enemies, p. 124)

spell.name: Happy Gas
entries: You deploy an imperceptible mood-altering gas at a creature within range that isn't hostile toward you. For the duration, you have advantage on all Charisma checks directed at that creature. The effect ends early if you are more than 10 feet from the target for longer than 10 seconds.

When the spell ends, the creature realizes that you used a substance to influence its mood and becomes hostile toward you. A creature {@condition prone} to violence might attack you. Another creature might seek retribution in other ways (at the DMâs discretion), depending on the nature of your interaction with it.

spell.name: Speed Serum
entries: You inject a creature with a muscle stimulant. For the duration, the target's speed increases by 10 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.
PHB (Longstrider, p. 256)

spell.name: Assault
entries: Until the start of your next turn, each creature you choose within range gains the following benefits:
- Speed is increased by 10 feet.
- The creature can make one weapon attack as a bonus action on their turn.
Hyperlanes (p. 112)

spell.name: Break Away

time.condition: which you take when a hostile creature moves within 5 feet of you

entries: You can immediately move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
Hyperlanes (p. 115)

spell.name: Fog Cloud
entries: You deploy a device that produces a 20-foot radius sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius of the fog increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 1st.
PHB (p. 243)

spell.name: Detect Poison and Disease
entries: For the duration, your scanner can sense the presence and location of poisons, poisonous creatures, and diseases within 30 feet of you. You also identify the kind of poison, poisonous creature, or disease in each case.
PHB (p. 231)

spell.name: Harmful Injection
entries: You inject a creature with a harmful substance that causes tissue damage. Make a melee power attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.
PHB (Inflict Wounds, p. 253)

spell.name: Light 'Em Up
entries: Before the end of your turn, you can make two ranged weapon attacks. You can use your powercasting ability, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this power using a power slot of 2nd level or higher, make one additional ranged weapon attack for each slot level above 1st.
Hyperlanes (Double Tap, p. 123)

items: An exposed creature can't benefit from half or three-quarters cover.
A prone creatureâs only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls using melee or two-handed ranged weapons.
An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. An attack roll has disadvantage if the attacker is beyond 15 feet of the creature.
A suppressed creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
